definition: sterilized absorbent cotton wool (used for dressings or cleansing wounds)/sanitary napkin/tampon
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
generic term for cotton or kapok/cotton/padded or quilted with cotton

sentences.english: That was my last tampon . Are you packing?
sentences.chinese: 那是我最后一个卫生棉条你有带吗？
买洗头液不难，买卫生棉条呢？

sentences.english: Ideally, how long should you leave in a tampon?
sentences.chinese: 理想情况下，你应该多长时间留在一个卫生棉条？

sentences.english: Even then I knew that tampons are gentle and tender lovers.
sentences.chinese: 即使在那时我也知道，卫生棉条是温和及温柔的情人。

sentences.english: I know cigarettes and tampons have a lot in common.
sentences.chinese: 我知道香烟和卫生棉条有很多共同之处。

sentences.english: Have you ever heard this sanitary napkin?
And I still have mixed feelings. I mean, how can you conflate cigarettes and tampons ?
sentences.chinese: 我的意思是，你怎么能把香烟及卫生棉条混为一谈？

sentences.english: Every month, I seem to go through an endless number of disposal pads and tampons.
sentences.chinese: 每个月，我似乎都用去了无数的卫生巾和卫生棉。

sentences.english: When your partner runs out to buy you tampons.
sentences.chinese: 当你的伴侣跑出去为你买卫生棉的时候。
